Yes I have it too! It's a frustrating symptom to have as it makes it difficult to write or do anything with fine motor skills required. I am using voice to text on my phone right now because even texting is difficult. :( I got some braces at Walgreens to wear at night and that seems to help along with staying hydrated.
Please add me too! thank you!
Cheese, olives, nuts, avocado, a glass of almond milk.

The dietician I've been seeing about my GD recommended a high-protein snacks such as cheese or almonds without any carbs, sugar and/or fruit at night time. The toast is probably too high in carbs for a nighttime snack. My fasting numbers were also too high until I started limiting myself to only cheese, nuts, or olives at nighttime.

WRITING.TEXT: Sure thing! This is my first pregnancy and it really freaked me out to have cramps so early on because I thought I was having a miscarriage. It was a relief to find out it was normal for a lot of women!
I had cramps too! It's probably round ligament pain. Your uterus is expanding rapidly to make room for baby!
I had some swelling in my labia and vagina and some flesh protruded from my vagina that turned out to be a remnant of my hymen.
He's beautiful!! Thank you for sharing your birth story!

I don't know if my brother fully understands that I'm pregnant. He is not verbal at all, as he lost his speech about 5 years ago, so it's tough to know if he fully gets that he going to be an uncle. He loves babies though and I think when we bring the baby home he will be so excited and he'll get it! Unfortunately I live across the country but we do get to FaceTime, which helps a lot. Thanks for linking to the shirt, I was gonna ask where you got it! That's a great idea!

My brother has DS too and is 27 years old, and this will be his first time being an uncle! I love that you got him an uncle shirt! I'm going to do the same for my little brother. Maybe with the whole hospital thing, I would personally change my vocabulary when talking with him if he seems to be kinda fixated on the word "hospital" and associating it with bad times. Maybe instead say you are going to have the baby with a special doctor who goes to school just to help mamas have their babies. And talk about that more than the physical place where it happens?
See this sounds very similar to our shower plans and I'd like it to be very casual and more like a regular party versus a formal shower
I like the idea of BINGO or some other fun distraction for guests to engage in during present opening so it's less boring
I'd be open to going with the flow like this too, I'm mostly afraid of boring my guests, since many of them don't have kids and I'm not sure they'd be interested
Glad to know I'm not alone! I do wonder if it makes a difference that my invite list is a younger crowd of mostly 35 and under and most of whom are not parents or traditional folks.
See that's what I would be afraid of happening! I suppose I could always have my husband open the gifts and then I'd be off the hook!
Thank you!!

WRITING.TITLE: What's this? Zone 8 Oregon

WRITING.TEXT:
Diclegis really helped me out when I was puking on average 6 times a day and couldn't keep anything down. It also really helped to drink a protein drink/shake first thing in the morning before I even got out of bed.
The protein is supposed to reduce nausea and it also keeps you full longer. Having an empty stomach makes the sickness so much worse. It's one of the ironic cruelties of morning sickness that it can spiral into more sickness as your stomach becomes progressively empty from puking.
Try to keep her entertained with books, movies, podcasts, anything to make the time pass. For most women, things get better after 12 weeks. Hang in there!
Sorry, given the timing of your post, I couldn't help myself. But I do sincerely love your nursery!!
What's Amelia Earhart's favorite holiday? (May Day! May Day! )
Good point! And on closer look the leaves are quite different. It does look more like hounds tongue!
Definitely looks like Thimbleberry! When the fruit ripens, it'll be bright red and super tasty.

WRITING.TITLE: Pregnancy achievement unlocked...

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! Yes it is a greenhouse! I'm a farmer. And since I've been pregnant, I have to admit I've been farming in my pj's an awful lot!
I think I just popped this week! 15 + 4, I'm afraid I'm going to be huge by the time this baby gets here! http://imgur.com/we8pQGB

You should have him look into holistic grazing. There are ways of raising animals which mimic the ecosystem functions of herbivores. Every ecosystem on earth is crucially dependent on animals. No creature on earth can live separate from this natural cycle. Also, "veganic" farming is a myth. Even conventional vegetable production happens at the expense of catastrophic ecosystem destruction ( loss of habitat for animals) in order to grow mono cultures of single crops. If you want to eat vegetables that are grown in healthy ecosystems, there will be animals involved, in a holistic fashion, i.e. Permaculture and organic small farms.
Thanks so much! I just got made my first 11 calls! Getting warmed up here!
Thanks!! I just watched and it was very helpful!
Thanks so much!!
Thanks! I like this shorter script much better, I did find the longer one that I'll reference too!
I want to start phone banking, but what do I say to people? Is there some sort of script I can loosely follow? I'm not sure where to start...
So cute!!

Just wow... what a horrible horrible MIL!!! I'm really glad you were their photographer!! I'm sure your personal experience helped you navigate the wedding and give the bride the beautiful photos she deserved!!
I was actually kind of relieved that she left so fast, so I guess I had to pay the price with our delicious leftovers, that bitch

Yeah after this one, I'm honestly not caring what happens next year, but I'm definitely not hosting. I hope we get invited somewhere else and can just ditch the inlaws, since they clearly don't give a fuck about having a happy holiday together.

Haha that was my exact interpretation of her bullshit! She was so pissed when it turned out to be an awesome day, despite her best efforts to sabotage! This last thanksgiving 2015, Luanne group texts everyone in our family the 1st week of September stating "let's all go for Chinese food this Thanksgiving!" And I fire back "lol MIL, it's not even Halloween yet, but just so you know I'm planning on hosting Thanksgiving this year since it was obviously too stressful for you last year to deal with".
So we had it at our tiny little apartment (sweet old landlady was out of town on business), and of course our dear family friends were invited. Luanne of course proceeds to show up two hours late, drink herself into a stupor and bitch about how our plates are "too small" and how she "just can't believe this is the new family tradition". Immediately after she finishes her food, she says "have fun cleaning up!" and orders doormat Dale to driver her home because she "doesn't feel well".
Oh yeah, and all she brought to dinner was two bottles of wine, which she drank one of herself, and took the other home with her. Also, before I realized what was happening, she also took nearly all the leftover turkey and side dishes home, so we ended up with no leftovers, which is the best part. So she still ended up managing to fuck us over... Grrrr!

WRITING.TITLE: Lousy Luanne (almost) ruins Thanksgiving
WRITING.TEXT:
My inlaws moved across the country to be close to us (aka meddle with our lives) in October 2014. They had been living in a motel for the past month while searching for an apartment that lived up to Luanne's impossible standards, and ended up moving into their apartment just two weeks before Thanksgiving.
Since no one else had offered by the time November rolled around, and my inlaws still didn't have a place yet, I had planned to host Thanksgiving for the family (my husband, his two cousins, my inlaws, and some close friends). I invited everyone, then when my inlaws moved into their new place, Lousy Luanne throws her weight and insists on changing the plans so she can host it herself at their apartment, where they haven't even unpacked and they don't even have a table to sit at. Since I was just getting to know them, I politely agreed and wanted to honor their family traditions and totally understood that Luanne would want to host her family.
Lousy Luanne says family only, no family friends (who had been with us for all previous holidays)... So trying to honor her wishes, I uninvited our friends, which was horribly awkward! I insisted that Luanne make an exception for our landlady, who is actually a dear friend of ours and is elderly and always alone on the holidays, so she usually spends them with us! Luanne is not happy about this inclusion for no apparent reason other than wanting to be in control of everything all the time.
Fast forward three weeks to Thanksgiving morning. We are supposed to get together at 3 for dinner. Fucking Luanne calls my DH at 9am crying that she is "too stressed to host Thanksgiving after all" and cancels the dinner!!! Apparently one of the main reasons Luanne flaked was because she just "couldn't stand to have a stranger at a family dinner" (meaning our sweet old landlady)
Not knowing what else to do, my husband and I quickly try to get shit together to host at our place and luckily, our sweet old landlady (who lives next door and has a much bigger kitchen and house) saved the day by allowing us to have everyone over at her place instead at the last minute! So my DH and cousin drive over to get the turkey and we all hustle our asses off to pull together a decent dinner. Since I was now hosting, I called our family friends and re-invited them over, explaining that MIL is apparently batshit insane!
So we manage to get dinner all ready by 4 somehow, and our amazing family friends bring over their dinner to join with ours, also totally saving the day!! We managed to have a feast prepared! And who decides not to show up until nearly 6? Goddamn Lousy Luanne and my poor FIL, doormat Dale.
The whole dinner Luanne drinks and sulks and pouts about how she can't believe we are "having a new tradition now". Fuck you Luanne!!

She is generally always saying something inappropriate, whether in restaurants or to whoever, but it's very often directed at me. My husband has tried to call her out on it and she says she is "just so nervous trying to please your wife" that she accidentally says mean things all the time. When we call her out on it in the moment she always says "I didn't mean it like that" or "I'm sorry you misunderstood me". I'm not falling for it though, if someone consistently treats me poorly, there's not much to misunderstand!
Yes that's what I think he expects! My husband just laughs it off as "my mom is nuts" and it's way more difficult for me to continuously laugh off her shitty comments.
Right!
That's definitely what it feels like. My husband still defends her though and says "you just need to get used to my mom saying stupid shitty things"
Right? I guess I should be slamming back hard liquor like her so I can join the party.

WRITING.TITLE: Introducing Lousy Luanne
WRITING.TEXT:
This is my first time posting, but I've been visiting this sub for solace for months! I'll call my MIL "Lousy Luanne". DH and I have been married only a few years, but I have many stories to share about Luanne and her lousy behavior, which has only increased since she and my FIL moved across the country to be "closer to us", aka meddle with our lives constantly. I'll dub my FIL "Doormat Dale" for now, as he is the classic sweet guy but a total pushover who enables the hell out of Lousy Luanne.
I'll get into some more stories later, but for now, I'll stick with some ultra light Luanne BS that occurred tonight.
I am 13 weeks pregnant, which is relevant to the story. So DH and I go to dinner at Luanne and Dan's tonight with DH's two cousins. We walk in and Lousy Luanne makes a big fuss over her niece and nephew and son, gives all a big hug, but does not hug me or even acknowledge me with a hello. Then she asks if anyone wants a drink (Luanne has already likely had several drinks before we arrived, her favorite lately being straight vodka).
She says "I've got this kind of beer and then I have some apple juice for the party pooper" referring to me. She says it in a mean way, not as a joke, as she gestures towards me. My DH (who has been trying to stick up for me more) says "what is that supposed to mean mom?" And she tries to back peddle by saying "well, I didn't mean it like that, it's just that she's pregnant, so she's a party pooper".
So apparently because I'm not drinking while I'm pregnant with her GRANDBABY, that makes me a party pooper.
This alone wouldn't be so bad, it's just a small example of the lousy things Luanne says on the regular. More stories to follow!
Haha so that could be a good sign if we do end up going with Ulysses... Folks might become more fond over time perhaps
I like the full name Harold (makes me think of Harold and Maude), but I hate the nn Harry.

Sounds like we're in a similar position! I'm warming up to he name myself, but I agree it's a lot of name to grow into! I like Uly for the same reason, it's a very soft nickname to contrast the larger than life Ulysses. It's funny though because my husband thinks of Ulysses as "whimsical", which I don't quite get at first impression.
That's true, it could be a good middle!
I haven't seen that show! Good to know, thank you!!
Thank you, yes I think bold is a better way to describe it! If it seems to bold for the kid as they grow, do you think Uly as a nn softens it?
Thanks! I appreciate that feedback!
That's a great way to put it! I think this was my concern, what it it doesn't fit and the kid had this big name? But would Uly fit a shy awkward kid?

WRITING.TITLE: What are your thoughts on Ulysses?
WRITING.TEXT: We like the nickname "Uly" pronounced "you-lee" and are wondering what are your thoughts on Ulysses as a boy name? My husband is a fan of James Joyce, which would be the primary inspiration. I like the name, but am worried it is too stuffy or old fashioned? We have had mixed reviews from friends and family, wondering what you guys think!
Have you gardened before?
Why don't you grow some straw then?

It's clear from your site that you're marketing to industrial scale agriculture/monoculture farms. I'm sure they'd love your product. And I don't mean that as a compliment. Organic farms and gardeners are not into it. It's just not a progressive product, however greenwashed you make it.
I never use plastics, bio or not. Use real biodegradable mulch, straw and wood chips. They're often free. Why pay for something synthetic?

When I was a kid, my cousin convinced me that owl pellets were highly valuable, since he heard school districts will buy them to use for class dissections. I spent a whole summer thinking I'd be rich collecting all the pellets. I never did find a buyer, although maybe I just didn't have the right connections as a five year old.

WRITING.TITLE: Siblings: Then and Now (more inside)

WRITING.TEXT: It depends.
Desk pillow.
The vines look like Himalayan Blackberries. You have to physically remove the root systems in order to get rid of them. Don't ever spray or apply gasoline etc, it doesn't work and it's toxic.
Seconding this. I think Greg is a female. Source: I'm a farmer with ducks.

One excellent example of this sort of permaculture schoolyard is Sunnyside Environmental School in Portland, Or. Check out Michael Becker's work too at Hood River Middle school. [Here's](http://clearingmagazine.org/archives/881) an article about his work.

Speaking as an organic farmer who raises birds free range on pasture, it makes me sad to think of birds confined to such a small space. The purpose of chicken tractors is to move them frequently so that the birds always have access to fresh greens. In contrast, I don't think bees appreciate their hives being moved regularly(despite the fact that commercial beekeepers have begun to move their hives, which stresses the bees).This is not a good idea. How about free range birds with a stationary hive?

There's also Winslow Food Forest. They have a 20 week harvest share for 2015, for $600, but is on sale through December for $550. Organic heirloom veggies, orchard fruits, berries, flowers, culinary herbs and pastured eggs included every week! Check their site: www.winslowfoodforest.com
They also offer a Seedling Subscription, with home delivery service.

Don't move to California. There are already too many people there for it to be a sustainable place to settle, as is evidenced by many CA residents moving due to water scarcity.
Also, please please don't try to keep this many animals in a city yard. First off, it would be illegal in most places, plus plain cruel to the animals. If you want this lifestyle, you need more land.
Fun people and good beer at Pyramid Scheme, Stella's, and Founders. Check out art shows at UICA, go check out 'Blues on the Mall', the weekly summer downtown festival.

WRITING.TITLE: Juice Rap News: Net Neutrality

WRITING.TEXT: Hi Reddit folk, my sister made this video on behalf of our brother Jared, who has Down Syndrome. Whichever video gets the most votes on youtube, wins $1k for their organization of choice. Check it out, vote if you'd like! Thanks!
I love it. Double exposures can be hit or miss but I think you hit this one.

I found these books inspiring and helpful:
* *One Straw Revolution* and *Sowing Seeds in the Desert* both by Masanobu Fukuoka
* *Gaia's Garden* by Toby Hemenway
Also, it's okay if gardening isn't as much your thing as botany is! Just follow that spark and you'll find a place to contribute within the permaculture movement, whatever that means.
Not my dream! I like my fruit to reproduce on it's own.
How much were you influenced by the 1950's television show, "The M Squad"?

Go to planned parenthood and do not your insurance through your dad. I once needed a service covered there and was "insured" (poorly) through my school. I simply did not list the schools insurance, and was covered through planned parenthoods low-income program.

Farmer here...Most seed packets will have germination rates showing what percentage of the seeds sprout, or grow, on average. Find out what hardiness zone you live in and then you can get a better idea of what you'd like to grow. Start small and have success and happiness. What do you want to eat? Give it a try! Also, no need for miracle grow, have a compost pile instead! Or try lasagna gardening to build up soil without tilling.
Here is a good site. Just enter your zip code and it will show you food banks near you. Hang in there! http://feedingamerica.org/foodbank-results.aspx

I had shingles when I was 13, which is pretty uncommon at that age. I had the blisters on my left armpit and chest. It left me with some nerve damage. Now, when I lightly touch the area where the shingles were, I can feel it on my left cheek as a ticklish or itching sensation.
You're look so beautiful and happy! I love your hair colors!

Don't even dignify the experience as your "first date". I bet that's still in your future. You're not alone.it's not uncommon to have at least one "ick" moment such as this when you're first starting to navigate the dating world and sexual experiences. Just remember that it's perfectly ok for you to be assertive and to let boys know what you're comfortable with. It's also totally ok to let your partners know what you want, and to value your own pleasure. If a guy isn't okay with that, then he's not worthy of you! Hang in there, this shall pass. There are good guys out there!

Asparagus patches takes 3 years before you can harvest, but then the plants lives for 20+ years. If you plan on being at your location for a long time,I would go mainly with perennials, as they come back year after year (versus annuals). Other perennials for zone 5: Jerusalem Artichoke and rhubarb. garlics and chives behave as perennials, as they come back each year.
Then, plant some fruit trees if you have the space! Apples would do great in zone 5!

First, I say go for it, but continue to be thoughtful, cos it'd be awesome to pull it off! Get heavy duty bike tires, they'll be better, I promise! And five chickens is probably too many for your particular set up, as there is stress in being kept in a tiny area with that many other birds. I'd say maybe 3 at the most would be more than enough for one person! Also maybe raise the chicken area into your sleeping area ever so slightly, to avoid the bottom of the chicken coop from dragging on the ground in rougher terrain. Also, chickens love sprouts, so you can feed them those too plus the bugs, great thinkin!

WRITING.TITLE: Brother with Down Syndrome... (cross-post from r/getwell)
WRITING.TEXT:
[Here we are in 1990](http://imgur.com/RSZBWEO)
[Here we are in 2010](http://imgur.com/FKgrdM5)
My brother Jared was always the happiest little boy. He loves singing and reading. His favorites are snoopy, clifford, and whinny the pooh. A few years back, my family began to notice a difference in Jared's behavior. He wanted to sleep all the time, started having bed wetting accidents and has significantly decreased his speech and interaction with others. He was diagnosed with depression by a specialist in the area where my parents live. Here's the thing: his symptoms started when my other brother and I moved out of state to go to college. And my parents say he only really smiles and talks when we call or when we visit. It breaks my heart and I know it's making my whole family sad for Jared.
My out-of-state brother and I have been sending Jared letters and little homemade gifts and we also make sure to do facetime (like skype) every week to help him put a face to our far away voices.
Anyway.. I found this subreddit today and I thought maybe some of you might want to send him a letter/drawing in the mail. I set up an email address for him too(jaredrocks@zilladog.net). His reading is at a 2nd grade level, so he really likes videos and he loves music. He would love to get a video of you playing a song, or just saying hi to him. I know he's lonely, and I think a little love from ya'll might cheer him up.
Thanks for sending love. It means the world to so many people.
He'll love that! Thanks!
Cool! He loves animals too so I know he'll be happy to see your ferrets !

I bet he'll love that. I'll let my mom know to help him check his email today, as he has some messages from some internet friends! :) PS: thanks for the compliment, I actually feel a lot of guilt being away at college because I know it's hard on Jared to have his siblings away from home.

WRITING.TITLE: Offer...
WRITING.TEXT:
I'll send homemade cards, pressed flowers/leaves, photos, art, trinkets well wishes, etc to anyone. PM me with requests. I really like this subreddit.
Love

Oh, he would love that!! He likes a lot of music, but a song that always makes him laugh is "Pop Goes the Weasel". He also loves the Beatles, and lots of Disney tunes. He has a keyboard and a guitar that he likes to plays! Thanks! I'll PM you...
That would be awesome! It makes us really sad too, but I think things like this would really touch his heart. Thank you!
Yay! Thanks for that! I think it will cheer him up just to have some internet interactions with people. Thanks for taking time.

WRITING.TITLE: My Brother Jared has Down Syndrome and has been diagnosed with depression (more info in text)
WRITING.TEXT:
[Here we are in 1990](http://imgur.com/RSZBWEO)
[Here we are in 2010](http://imgur.com/FKgrdM5)
My brother Jared was always the happiest little boy. He loves singing and reading. His favorites are snoopy, clifford, and whinny the pooh. A few years back, my family began to notice a difference in Jared's behavior. He wanted to sleep all the time, started having bed wetting accidents and has significantly decreased his speech and interaction with others. He was diagnosed with depression by a specialist in the area where my parents live. Here's the thing: his symptoms started when my other brother and I moved out of state to go to college. And my parents say he only really smiles and talks when we call or when we visit. It breaks my heart and I know it's making my whole family sad for Jared.
My out-of-state brother and I have been sending Jared letters and little homemade gifts and we also make sure to do facetime (like skype) every week to help him put a face to our far away voices.
Anyway.. I found this subreddit today and I thought maybe some of you might want to send him a letter/drawing in the mail. I set up an email address for him too(jaredrocks@zilladog.net). His reading is at a 2nd grade level, so he really likes videos and he loves music. He would love to get a video of you playing a song, or just saying hi to him. I know he's lonely, and I think a little love from ya'll might cheer him up.
Thanks for sending love. It means the world to so many people.

Herpes can lie dormant for months before the anti-bodies show up in a blood test. Unfortunately, unless you tested negative before sex with your new partner, there's really no way to pinpoint him as the one who exposed you.
Also, herpes outbreaks are more prone during periods of immunity weakness. The healthier you are, the less likely you'll have an outbreak. Lastly, herpes is only a skin condition, not much different from acne or eczema. The social stigma is far worse than herpes itself.

i am a pastor's kid. i could have had a special rate and my parent's paying tuition at some yuppy private christian schools. because i don't support organized religion as an atheist (even admittedly as an agnostic), I understand that funneling my parents money towards a christian school is a contradiction of my principles. You called yourself an *atheist* and perhaps you are quite simply unconcerned with the ramification and social consequences of organized religion and people being *mis*educated in college, then you should feel fine about being wishy-washy. I, however, have chosen to put myself through school, to stand on my principles. My folks (who i once was estranged from) have grown to be very proud of me for how hard I work. They even brag to their friends that their daughter knows how to take care of herself. This is in contrast to most people my age (probably you too) who haven't the *slightest* idea of how to support themselves. I work full time and take 16 credits. Suck it up, ya know?
I had a similar conundrum and I chose to support myself through college rather than support a Christian one through attendance.

I'm a 22-year-old woman and I attend college full-time, dating boyfriend for 3 years. Because I also work full-time to support myself and pay for school, I am pretty busy and stretched thin. Often, at the end of my day, the last thing I want to do is bike (no car) 8 miles to his house. Because he wants to see me, he usually is the one to make that 8 mile trek. Basically, what I'm saying is that given you've only dated for 2 months, the gal's got a lot on her plate and i guarantee that there is truth in her statements about work and busy-ness. It might be more comfortable for her to be in her own environment when she wakes up, because it helps her be successful in her busy days, ie: having all the accessories of home to start her day etc.
tips: make her feel "at home" as much as possible at your place. Cook her dinner, make sure you have food around if she's hungry, toilet paper in stock, clean, comfortable etc.
oh yeah, and no pressure, no guilt trips. you sound like you're doing well on this already, she's a lucky gal.
longwinded, but I hope I could be of some help, given my own similar scenario.
